org.tinyradius.server

Class AuthHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.SimpleChannelInboundHandler<io.netty.channel.socket.DatagramPacket>
          • org.tinyradius.server.ServerHandler<AccessRequest>
            • org.tinyradius.server.AuthHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler, io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandler

    public abstract class AuthHandler
extends ServerHandler<AccessRequest>
    Reference implementation of AccessRequest handler that returns Access-Accept/Reject depending on whether getUserPassword(String) matches password in Access-Request.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserPassword

        public abstract java.lang.String getUserPassword(java.lang.String userName)
        Returns the password of the passed user. Either this method or handlePacket(Channel, AccessRequest, InetSocketAddress, String) (EventExecutor, AccessRequest)} should be overridden.
        Parameters:
        userName - user name
        Returns:
        plain-text password or null if user unknown

      • handlePacket

        protected io.netty.util.concurrent.Promise<RadiusPacket> handlePacket(io.netty.channel.Channel channel,
                                                                      AccessRequest accessRequest,
                                                                      java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteAddress,
                                                                      java.lang.String sharedSecret)
        Constructs an answer for an Access-Request packet. This method should be overridden.
        Specified by:
        handlePacket in class ServerHandler<AccessRequest>
        Parameters:
        accessRequest - Radius clientRequest packet
        channel - socket which received packet
        remoteAddress - remote address the packet was sent by
        sharedSecret - shared secret associated with remoteAddress
        Returns:
        clientResponse packet or null if no packet shall be sent
